explanation: It handles user input through a form for creating new blog posts.
On a successful form submission, it saves the new blog post to the database.
It also retrieves and displays existing blog posts when accessed via GET.
response.hook: The home function serves as the entry point for both GET and POST requests.
response.next_click: Explore the MessageForm class for form handling details.
response.pitfall: Ensure proper validation to prevent incorrect data submissions.
response.title: GET|POST /
response.why_it_matters: This function is crucial for user interaction, allowing content creation and retrieval in the application.
